intro: Cheilanthes lutea, commonly known as the golden shield fern, is a species of fern found in arid and semi-arid regions. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and bright yellow to orange fronds. The plant belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to parts of North America, particularly the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in rocky soils and can often be found growing on limestone or sandstone. Cheilanthes lutea is known for its drought tolerance and ability to survive in harsh, dry environments.
